sentences.text: by
sentences.html: by

sentences.text: Vladimir Martyanov
sentences.html: Vladimir Martyanov

sentences.text: April 14, 202213 min read
sentences.html: April 14, 202213 min read

sentences.text: In this study we are considering one of Zeus successors Zloader 2. Well show how it works and its code peculiarities. Well present the result of our deep dive into the botnets and campaigns and show some interesting connections between Zloader and other malware families.
sentences.html: In this study we are considering one of Zeus successors – Zloader 2. We’ll show how it works and its code peculiarities. We’ll present the result of our deep dive into the botnets and campaigns and show some interesting connections between Zloader and other malware families.

sentences.text: Zloader 2 (also known as Silent Night) is a multifunctional modular banking malware, aimed at providing unauthorized access to online banking systems, payment systems and other financial-related services. In addition to these functions its able to download and execute arbitrary files, steal files, inject arbitrary code to visited HTML pages and so on.
sentences.html: Zloader 2 (also known as Silent Night) is a multifunctional modular banking malware, aimed at providing unauthorized access to online banking systems, payment systems and other financial-related services. In addition to these functions it’s able to download and execute arbitrary files, steal files, inject arbitrary code to visited HTML pages and so on.

sentences.text: According to ZeusMuseum, first versions of Zeus were observed in 2006-2008. Later, in 2011 its source code leaked. As a result, new versions and variants appeared. One of the Zeus successors named Zloader appeared at the turn of 2016 and 2017. Finally, another successor named Silent Night appeared in 2019. It was for sale on the underground market.
sentences.html: According to ZeusMuseum, first versions of Zeus were observed in 2006-2008. Later, in 2011 its source code leaked. As a result, new versions and variants appeared. One of the Zeus successors named Zloader appeared at the turn of 2016 and 2017. Finally, another successor named Silent Night appeared in 2019. It was for sale on the underground market.

sentences.text: The earliest version of this variant we found has a SHA256:<crlf>384f3719ba4fbcf355cc206e27f3bfca94e7bf14dd928de62ab5f74de90df34a<crlf>Timestamp 4 December 2019 and version number 1.0.2.0. In the middle of July 2021 the version 2.0.0.0 was spotted.
sentences.html: The earliest version of this variant we found has a SHA256: 384f3719ba4fbcf355cc206e27f3bfca94e7bf14dd928de62ab5f74de90df34a Timestamp 4 December 2019 and version number 1.0.2.0. In the middle of July 2021 the version 2.0.0.0 was spotted.

sentences.text: Microsoft recently announced a joint investigation of multiple security companies and information sharing and analysis centers (ISACs) with the aim to take down the Zloader botnet and took the whole case to court.
sentences.html: Microsoft recently announced a joint investigation of multiple security companies and information sharing and analysis centers (ISACs) with the aim to take down the Zloader botnet and took the whole case to court.

sentences.text: Although the original name of the malware likely was Silent Night and the ZeusMuseum calls it Zloader 2 we are simply going to use the name Zloader.
sentences.html: Although the original name of the malware likely was Silent Night and the ZeusMuseum calls it Zloader 2 we are simply going to use the name Zloader.

sentences.text: Zloader consists of different modules and components:
sentences.html: Zloader consists of different modules and components:

sentences.text: Downloader initial infector<crlf>Backdoor main module, exists in x86 and x64 versions<crlf>VNC module (x86 and x64)<crlf>Web Injects received from C&C<crlf>Additional libraries (openssl, sqlite, zlib, Mozilla libraries)
sentences.html:
• Downloader – initial infector
  • Backdoor – main module, exists in x86 and x64 versions
  • VNC module (x86 and x64)
  • Web Injects – received from C&C
  • Additional libraries (openssl, sqlite, zlib, Mozilla libraries)

sentences.text: Backdoors, VNC modules and additional libraries have assigned module IDs that are used by other components to refer to them.
sentences.html: Backdoors, VNC modules and additional libraries have assigned module IDs that are used by other components to refer to them.

sentences.text: Zloader was distributed using classic email spam. In 2021 the attackers abused Google AdWords to advertise sites with fake Zoom communication tool which actually installed Zloader. Another campaign in 2021 used fake pornsites, where users needed to download additional software to watch video. Downloaders are distributed in a packed form sometimes signed with a valid digital signature.
sentences.html: Zloader was distributed using classic email spam. In 2021 the attackers abused Google AdWords to advertise sites with fake Zoom communication tool which actually installed Zloader. Another campaign in 2021 used fake pornsites, where users needed to download additional software to watch video. Downloaders are distributed in a packed form sometimes signed with a valid digital signature.

sentences.text: Map showing the distribution of infected systems:
sentences.html: Map showing the distribution of infected systems:

sentences.text: Zloader code is very recognizable. First of all, it is diluted with functions which will never be called. Downloader module may contain functions from the Backdoor module and vice versa. In total, about a half of the code will never be called.
sentences.html: Zloader code is very recognizable. First of all, it is diluted with functions which will never be called. Downloader module may contain functions from the Backdoor module and vice versa. In total, about a half of the code will never be called.

sentences.text: Second, simple x86 instructions like CMP, ADD and XOR are replaced with special functions. These functions contain a lot of useless code to complicate the analysis and they can call other replacement functions. To add more insult to the injury multiple replacement functions exist for a particular instruction. Also some constants are calculated in runtime using aforementioned replacement functions.
sentences.html: Second, simple x86 instructions like CMP, ADD and XOR are replaced with special functions. These functions contain a lot of useless code to complicate the analysis and they can call other “replacement” functions. To add more insult to the injury multiple “replacement” functions exist for a particular instruction. Also some constants are calculated in runtime using aforementioned “replacement” functions.

sentences.text: Strings are encrypted with a simple XOR algorithm.
sentences.html: Strings are encrypted with a simple XOR algorithm.

sentences.text: Samples have very little imported functions. APIs are resolved in runtime by the hashes of their names.
sentences.html: Samples have very little imported functions. APIs are resolved in runtime by the hashes of their names.

sentences.text: As a result, more than a half of the file size is useless and serves as an obfuscation of simple operations.
sentences.html: As a result, more than a half of the file size is useless and serves as an obfuscation of simple operations.

sentences.text: Both Downloader and Backdoor modules have built in configuration encrypted with RC4. The decryption key is stored in a plaintext and looks like vcvslrpvwwfanquofupxt. The structure of earlier versions (1.0.x, for example) differs from later versions (1.6.x and 1.8.x). Modern versions store the following information in config:
sentences.html: Both Downloader and Backdoor modules have built in configuration encrypted with RC4. The decryption key is stored in a plaintext and looks like vcvslrpvwwfanquofupxt. The structure of earlier versions (1.0.x, for example) differs from later versions (1.6.x and 1.8.x). Modern versions store the following information in config:

sentences.text: Botnet name (divader on the picture below)<crlf>Campaign name (xls_s_2010)<crlf>List of hardcoded C&Cs<crlf>RC4 key (03d5ae30a0bd934a23b6a7f0756aa504)
sentences.html:
• Botnet name (divader on the picture below)
  • Campaign name (xls_s_2010)
  • List of hardcoded C&Cs
  • RC4 key (03d5ae30a0bd934a23b6a7f0756aa504)

sentences.text: We have to briefly cover the BinStorage the data format used by Zloader to communicate with C&Cs and to store various data: web injects, system information, stolen data and logs. BinStorages consists of the header and records (also called fields). Main header stores information about the number of records, data size (in bytes) and their MD5. Records have their own small headers, containing FieldID - DWORD describing the meaning of the data.
sentences.html: We have to briefly cover the BinStorage – the data format used by Zloader to communicate with C&Cs and to store various data: web injects, system information, stolen data and logs. BinStorages consists of the header and records (also called fields). Main header stores information about the number of records, data size (in bytes) and their MD5. Records have their own small headers, containing FieldID - DWORD describing the meaning of the data.

sentences.text: Some FieldIDs are hardcoded. For example, in FieldID=0x4E20 the last working C&C is stored. Other FieldIDs are derived from file paths (used to store stolen files).
sentences.html: Some FieldIDs are hardcoded. For example, in FieldID=0x4E20 the last working C&C is stored. Other FieldIDs are derived from file paths (used to store stolen files).

sentences.text: Zloader modules (at least Downloaders and Backdoors) use a registry to store various data necessary for their work. The ROOT_KEY for this data is
sentences.html: Zloader modules (at least Downloaders and Backdoors) use a registry to store various data necessary for their work. The ROOT_KEY for this data is HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\

sentences.text: The most important and interesting data structure, stored by the Zloader in the registry is called MAIN_STRUCT. Its subkey in the ROOT_KEY and the value name is derived from the RC4 key found in the configuration. We suppose that bots from one actor use the same RC4 key, so they can easily find and read the MAIN_STRUCT.
sentences.html: The most important and interesting data structure, stored by the Zloader in the registry is called MAIN_STRUCT. It’s subkey in the ROOT_KEY and the value name is derived from the RC4 key found in the configuration. We suppose that bots from one actor use the same RC4 key, so they can easily find and read the MAIN_STRUCT.

sentences.text: MAIN_STRUCT is encrypted using RC4 with the key from the configuration. It stores:
sentences.html: MAIN_STRUCT is encrypted using RC4 with the key from the configuration. It stores:

sentences.text: Registry paths to other storages, used by Zloader<crlf>Files and directories path, used by Zloader<crlf>Encryption key(s) to decrypt those storages
sentences.html:
• Registry paths to other storages, used by Zloader
  • Files and directories path, used by Zloader
  • Encryption key(s) to decrypt those storages

sentences.text: Root path is %APPDATA%. Zloader creates directories with random names inside it to store modules, stolen data and logs. These paths are stored into the MAIN_STRUCT.
sentences.html: Root path is %APPDATA%. Zloader creates directories with random names inside it to store modules, stolen data and logs. These paths are stored into the MAIN_STRUCT.

sentences.text: As was mentioned before, communication between the bot and C&C is done using BinStorages. Depending on the actual type of the message, field list may be changed, but there are 5 constant fields sent to C&C:
sentences.html: As was mentioned before, communication between the bot and C&C is done using BinStorages. Depending on the actual type of the message, field list may be changed, but there are 5 constant fields sent to C&C:

sentences.text: Some DWORD from the Configuration<crlf>Botnet name from the Configuration<crlf>BotID, derived from the system information<crlf>Debug flag from the Configuration<crlf>16 random bytes
sentences.html:
• Some DWORD from the Configuration
  • Botnet name from the Configuration
  • BotID, derived from the system information
  • Debug flag from the Configuration
  • 16 random bytes

sentences.text: Requests are encrypted using the RC4 key from the Configuration. C&C responses are signed with RSA.
sentences.html: Requests are encrypted using the RC4 key from the Configuration. C&C responses are signed with RSA.

sentences.text: This request is used to check if C&C is alive. Response contains only random bytes sent by a bot.
sentences.html: This request is used to check if C&C is alive. Response contains only random bytes sent by a bot.

sentences.text: This request is used to download modules by their ID from the C&C. The response is not in a BinStorage form!
sentences.html: This request is used to download modules by their ID from the C&C. The response is not in a BinStorage form!

sentences.text: Used to receive configuration updates: new C&Cs, WebInjects, tasks for downloading etc.
sentences.html: Used to receive configuration updates: new C&Cs, WebInjects, tasks for downloading etc.

sentences.text: As was shown before, built in configuration has a list of hardcoded C&Cs. Actually, these lists have not changed for years. To bypass blocking of these hardcoded C&Cs, Zloader uses DGA Domain Generation Algorithm. In the Zloader, DGA produces 32 domains, based on the current date and RC4 key from the configuration.
sentences.html: As was shown before, built in configuration has a list of hardcoded C&Cs. Actually, these lists have not changed for years. To bypass blocking of these hardcoded C&Cs, Zloader uses DGA – Domain Generation Algorithm. In the Zloader, DGA produces 32 domains, based on the current date and RC4 key from the configuration.

sentences.text: There is a 3rd type of C&Cs received in the response from the server. Theyre stored into the Registry.
sentences.html: There is a 3rd type of C&Cs – received in the response from the server. They’re stored into the Registry.

sentences.text: Analysis based on version 1.6.28.0,
sentences.html: Analysis based on version 1.6.28.0, 44ede6e1b9be1c013f13d82645f7a9cff7d92b267778f19b46aa5c1f7fa3c10b

sentences.text: Function of Downloader is to download, install and run the next module the Backdoor.
sentences.html: Function of Downloader is to download, install and run the next module – the Backdoor.

sentences.text: Just after the start of the Downloader module, junk code is started. It consists of many junk functions, which forms a kind of a network. In the image below there is a call graph from just a single junk function. These functions also trying to read, write and delete some *.txt files %TEMP%. The purpose of this is to delay the execution of the payload and, We suppose, to complicate the emulation, debugging and analysis.
sentences.html: Just after the start of the Downloader module, junk code is started. It consists of many junk functions, which forms a kind of a “network”. In the image below there is a call graph from just a single junk function. These functions also trying to read, write and delete some *.txt files %TEMP%. The purpose of this is to delay the execution of the payload and, We suppose, to complicate the emulation, debugging and analysis.

sentences.text: The second and the last task of the Main function is to start msiexec.exe and perform the PE injection of the code into it. Injected data consists of two buffers: the big one, where the Downloader is stored in the encrypted form and the small one (0x42 bytes) with decryption code. Just after the injection Downloader terminates himself.
sentences.html: The second and the last task of the Main function is to start msiexec.exe and perform the PE injection of the code into it. Injected data consists of two buffers: the big one, where the Downloader is stored in the encrypted form and the small one (0x42 bytes) with decryption code. Just after the injection Downloader terminates himself.

sentences.text: Control flow passed to the small buffer, which decrypts the Downloader in the address space of msiexec.exe After the decryption, Downloader begins to execute its main task.
sentences.html: Control flow passed to the small buffer, which decrypts the Downloader in the address space of msiexec.exe After the decryption, Downloader begins to execute its main task.

sentences.text: First of all, the injected code tries to read MAIN_STRUCT from the registry. If this fails, it thinks it was not installed on this system and the installation process begins: MAIN_STRUCT is created, Downloader module is copied into %APPDATA% and added to the autorun key HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run with random value name.
sentences.html: First of all, the injected code tries to read MAIN_STRUCT from the registry. If this fails, it thinks it was not installed on this system and the installation process begins: MAIN_STRUCT is created, Downloader module is copied into %APPDATA% and added to the autorun key HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run with random value name.

sentences.text: In any case, the Backdoor module is requested from the disk or from the network and executed.
sentences.html: In any case, the Backdoor module is requested from the disk or from the network and executed.

sentences.text: Analysis based on version 1.6.28.0,
sentences.html: Analysis based on version 1.6.28.0, c7441a27727069ce11f8d54676f8397e85301b4d65d4d722c6b239a495fd0282

sentences.text: There are actually two Backdoor modules: for 32-bit systems (moduleID 0x3EE) and for 64-bit systems (moduleID 0x3E9). Downloader always requests a 32-bit Backdoor.
sentences.html: There are actually two Backdoor modules: for 32-bit systems (moduleID 0x3EE) and for 64-bit systems (moduleID 0x3E9). Downloader always requests a 32-bit Backdoor.

sentences.text: Backdoors are much more complicated than Downloaders. If we compare the size of our samples (after unpacking), Backdoor will be twice bigger.
sentences.html: Backdoors are much more complicated than Downloaders. If we compare the size of our samples (after unpacking), Backdoor will be twice bigger.

sentences.text: Key Backdoor abilities:
sentences.html: Key Backdoor abilities:

sentences.text: Starting VNC module<crlf>Injecting WebInjects into the pages visited using browsers<crlf>Downloading and execute arbitrary file<crlf>Keylogging<crlf>Making screenshots<crlf>Stealing files and sending to C&C
sentences.html:
• Starting VNC module
  • Injecting WebInjects into the pages visited using browsers
  • Downloading and execute arbitrary file
  • Keylogging
  • Making screenshots
  • Stealing files and sending to C&C

sentences.text: The largest group of software from which Zloader steal files is crypto wallets:
sentences.html: The largest group of software from which Zloader steal files is crypto wallets:

sentences.text: Electrum<crlf>Ethereum<crlf>Exodus cryptowallet<crlf>Zcash<crlf>Bitcoin-Qt<crlf>Etc.
sentences.html:
• Electrum
  • Ethereum
  • Exodus cryptowallet
  • Zcash
  • Bitcoin-Qt
  • Etc.

sentences.text: It also steals data from browsers: cookies from Chrome, Firefox and IE; saved logins from Chrome. And, finally, it is able to steal accounts information from Microsoft Outlook.
sentences.html: It also steals data from browsers: cookies from Chrome, Firefox and IE; saved logins from Chrome. And, finally, it is able to steal accounts information from Microsoft Outlook.

sentences.text: To achieve his goals, Zloader performs WinAPI hooking. In order to perform it, Backdoor module enumerates processes and injects itself into the following ones:
sentences.html: To achieve his goals, Zloader performs WinAPI hooking. In order to perform it, Backdoor module enumerates processes and injects itself into the following ones:

sentences.text: explorer.exe<crlf>msiexec.exe<crlf>iexplore.exe<crlf>firefox.exe<crlf>chrome.exe<crlf>msedge.exe
sentences.html:
• explorer.exe
  • msiexec.exe
  • iexplore.exe
  • firefox.exe
  • chrome.exe
  • msedge.exe

sentences.text: 64-bit version of Backdoor is injected into 64-bit processes, 32-bit version into 32-bit processes.
sentences.html: 64-bit version of Backdoor is injected into 64-bit processes, 32-bit version – into 32-bit processes.

sentences.text: Injected code hooks the following WinAPI functions:
sentences.html: Injected code hooks the following WinAPI functions:

sentences.text: NtCreateUserProcess<crlf>NtCreateThread<crlf>ZwDeviceIoControlFile<crlf>TranslateMessage<crlf>CertGetCertificateChain<crlf>CertVerifyCertificateChainPolicy
sentences.html:
• NtCreateUserProcess
  • NtCreateThread
  • ZwDeviceIoControlFile
  • TranslateMessage
  • CertGetCertificateChain
  • CertVerifyCertificateChainPolicy

sentences.text: Hooks might be divided in 3 groups, depending on the purpose:
sentences.html: Hooks might be divided in 3 groups, depending on the purpose:

sentences.text: NtCreateUserProcess and NtCreateThread are hooked to inject a Backdoor module to newly created threads and processes.<crlf>ZwDeviceIoControlFile, CertGetCertificateChain and CertVerifyCertificateChainPolicy are hooked to support WebInjection mechanism<crlf>TranslateMessage is hooked to log the keys pressed and to create screenshots
sentences.html:
1. NtCreateUserProcess and NtCreateThread are hooked to inject a Backdoor module to newly created threads and processes.
  2. ZwDeviceIoControlFile, CertGetCertificateChain and CertVerifyCertificateChainPolicy are hooked to support WebInjection mechanism
  3. TranslateMessage is hooked to log the keys pressed and to create screenshots

sentences.text: First of all, browsers must have a Backdoor module injected. At this moment, there are multiple instances of Backdoor Modules running in the system: one, started by Downloader which is Main Instance and others, running in browsers. Main Instance starts Man-in-the-browser proxy, other modules hooks ZwDeviceIoControlFile and cert-related WinAPIs (see above). Proxy port number is stored in the BinStorage structure into the Registry, so it is synchronized between Backdoor instances.
sentences.html: First of all, browsers must have a Backdoor module injected. At this moment, there are multiple instances of Backdoor Modules running in the system: one, started by Downloader which is “Main Instance” and others, running in browsers. Main Instance starts Man-in-the-browser proxy, other modules hooks ZwDeviceIoControlFile and cert-related WinAPIs (see above). Proxy port number is stored in the BinStorage structure into the Registry, so it is synchronized between Backdoor instances.

sentences.text: Hooked ZwDeviceIoControlFile function is waiting for IOCTL_AFD_CONNECT or IOCTL_AFD_SUPER_CONNECT and routing connections to the proxy. Hooked cert-related functions inform browsers what everything is good with certificates.
sentences.html: Hooked ZwDeviceIoControlFile function is waiting for IOCTL_AFD_CONNECT or IOCTL_AFD_SUPER_CONNECT and routing connections to the proxy. Hooked cert-related functions inform browsers what everything is good with certificates.

sentences.text: Most active botnets and campaigns use RC4 key 03d5ae30a0bd934a23b6a7f0756aa504 and well focus on them in our analysis. Samples with the aforementioned key have versions 1.x, usually 1.6.28, but some have even 1.0.x.
sentences.html: Most active botnets and campaigns use RC4 key 03d5ae30a0bd934a23b6a7f0756aa504 and we’ll focus on them in our analysis. Samples with the aforementioned key have versions 1.x, usually 1.6.28, but some have even 1.0.x.

sentences.text: Among botnet names it is worth mentioning the following groups:
sentences.html: Among botnet names it is worth mentioning the following groups:

sentences.text: DLLobnova, AktualizacjaDLL, googleaktualizacija, googleaktualizacija1, obnovlenie19, vasja, ivan<crlf>9092zi, 9092ti, 9092ca, 9092us, 909222, 9092ge
sentences.html:
1. DLLobnova, AktualizacjaDLL, googleaktualizacija, googleaktualizacija1, obnovlenie19, vasja, ivan
  2. 9092zi, 9092ti, 9092ca, 9092us, 909222, 9092ge

sentences.text: The first one contains transliterated Slavic words and names (vasja, ivan), maybe with errors. It sheds light on the origins of bad guys they are definitely Slavs.
sentences.html: The first one contains transliterated Slavic words and names (vasja, ivan), maybe with errors. It sheds light on the origins of bad guys – they are definitely Slavs.

sentences.text: Samples with botnet names from the second group were first observed in November 2021 and we found 6 botnet names from this group in the next two months. Letters after numbers, like ca and us might be country codes.
sentences.html: Samples with botnet names from the second group were first observed in November 2021 and we found 6 botnet names from this group in the next two months. Letters after numbers, like ca and us might be country codes.

sentences.text: We see the same picture with campaign names: quite a big amount of Slavic words and the same 9092* group.
sentences.html: We see the same picture with campaign names: quite a big amount of Slavic words and the same 9092* group.

sentences.text: We analyzed webinjects and can confirm that they are targeting financial companies: banks, brokerage firms, insurance companies, payment services, cryptocurrency-related services etc.
sentences.html: We analyzed webinjects and can confirm that they are targeting financial companies: banks, brokerage firms, insurance companies, payment services, cryptocurrency-related services etc.

sentences.text: Injected code is usually small: from dozens of bytes up to 20 kb. To perform its tasks, it loads JavaScript code from external domains, controlled by bad guys. Analysis of these domains allowed us to find connections between Zloader operators and other cybercrime gangs.
sentences.html: Injected code is usually small: from dozens of bytes up to 20 kb. To perform its tasks, it loads JavaScript code from external domains, controlled by bad guys. Analysis of these domains allowed us to find connections between Zloader operators and other cybercrime gangs.

sentences.text: Zloader is able to download and execute arbitrary files by the commands from his C&Cs, but for a long time we havent seen these commands at all. Things changed on 24 November 2021, when botnet 9092ca received a command to download and execute the file from teamworks455[.]com. This domain was mentioned in [6].
sentences.html: Zloader is able to download and execute arbitrary files by the commands from his C&Cs, but for a long time we haven’t seen these commands at all. Things changed on 24 November 2021, when botnet 9092ca received a command to download and execute the file from teamworks455[.]com. This domain was mentioned in [6].

sentences.text: Another two download tasks contained braves[.]fun and
sentences.html: Another two download tasks contained braves[.]fun and endoftheendi[.]com

sentences.text: During our tracking we have noticed links to other malware families we originally thought were unrelated.
sentences.html: During our tracking we have noticed links to other malware families we originally thought were unrelated.

sentences.text: Two out of three download tasks contained links to Raccoon Stealer. Downloaded samples have the following sha256 hashes:
sentences.html: Two out of three download tasks contained links to Raccoon Stealer. Downloaded samples have the following sha256 hashes:

• 5da3db74eee74412c1290393a0a0487c63b2c022e57aebcd632f0c3caf23d8bc
  • 5b731854c58c2c1316633e570c9ec82474347e64b07ace48017d0be2b6331eed

sentences.text: Both of them have the same Raccoon configuration with Telegram channel kumchakl1.
sentences.html: Both of them have the same Raccoon configuration with Telegram channel kumchakl1.

sentences.text: Moreover, Raccoon was mentioned in [6] before we received commands from C&Cs with links to Raccoon. We are lost in conjecture why Zloader operators used Raccoon Stealer? You can read our dive into Racoon stealer here.
sentences.html: Moreover, Raccoon was mentioned in [6] before we received commands from C&Cs with links to Raccoon. We are lost in conjecture why Zloader operators used Raccoon Stealer? You can read our dive into Racoon stealer here.

sentences.text: Ursnif, also known as Gozi and ISFB is another banking malware family with similar functions.
sentences.html: Ursnif, also known as Gozi and ISFB is another banking malware family with similar functions.

sentences.text: It was quite a big surprise when we found Zloader samples and Ursnif samples signed with the same digital signature!
sentences.html: It was quite a big surprise when we found Zloader samples and Ursnif samples signed with the same digital signature!

sentences.text: As an example, consider a signature:<crlf>Issuer BABJNCXZHQCJUVWAJJ<crlf>Thumbprint 46C79BD6482E287647B1D6700176A5F6F5AC6D57.
sentences.html: As an example, consider a signature: Issuer BABJNCXZHQCJUVWAJJ Thumbprint 46C79BD6482E287647B1D6700176A5F6F5AC6D57.

sentences.text: Zloader sample signed with it has a SHA256 hash:<crlf>2a9ff0a0e962d28c488af9767770d48b9128b19ee43e8df392efb2f1c5a696f.
sentences.html: Zloader sample signed with it has a SHA256 hash: 2a9ff0a0e962d28c488af9767770d48b9128b19ee43e8df392efb2f1c5a696f.

sentences.text: Signed Ursnif sample has a SHA256 hash:
sentences.html: Signed Ursnif sample has a SHA256 hash: 54e6e6b23dec0432da2b36713a206169468f4f9d7691ccf449d7d946617eca45

sentences.text: It is not the only digital signature, shared among Ursnif and Zloader samples.
sentences.html: It is not the only digital signature, shared among Ursnif and Zloader samples.

sentences.text: As we mentioned before, the first observed download command contained a link to teamworks455[.]com. We checked the TLS certificate for this site and realized that it was for another site dotxvcnjlvdajkwerwoh[.]com. We saw this hostname on 11 November 2021 in Ursnif webinjects, it was used to receive stolen data.
sentences.html: As we mentioned before, the first observed download command contained a link to teamworks455[.]com. We checked the TLS certificate for this site and realized that it was for another site – dotxvcnjlvdajkwerwoh[.]com. We saw this hostname on 11 November 2021 in Ursnif webinjects, it was used to receive stolen data.

sentences.text: Another example aerulonoured[.]su host used by Zloader to receive stolen data at least from August 2021. It also appeared in Ursnif webinjects in November 2021.
sentences.html: Another example – aerulonoured[.]su – host used by Zloader to receive stolen data at least from August 2021. It also appeared in Ursnif webinjects in November 2021.

sentences.text: Third example qyfurihpsbhbuvitilgw[.]com which was found in Zeus configuration update, received from C&C on 20 October 2021. It must be added to a C&C list and then used by Zloader bots. The same domain was found in Ursnif webinjects on 1 November 2021
sentences.html: Third example – qyfurihpsbhbuvitilgw[.]com which was found in Zeus configuration update, received from C&C on 20 October 2021. It must be added to a C&C list and then used by Zloader bots. The same domain was found in Ursnif webinjects on 1 November 2021

sentences.text: And, finally, 4th example etjmejjcxjtwweitluuw[.]com This domain was generated using DGA from key 03d5ae30a0bd934a23b6a7f0756aa504 and date 22 September 2021. We have very strong evidence that it was active on that date as a Zloader C&C. The same host was found in Ursnif WebInjects on 1 November 2021
sentences.html: And, finally, 4th example – etjmejjcxjtwweitluuw[.]com This domain was generated using DGA from key 03d5ae30a0bd934a23b6a7f0756aa504 and date – 22 September 2021. We have very strong evidence that it was active on that date as a Zloader C&C. The same host was found in Ursnif WebInjects on 1 November 2021

sentences.text: We are proud we could be part of the investigation as we continue our mission to make the world a safer place for everybody. We hope for a successful takedown of the Zloader botnet and prosecution of people who created and operated it.
